articles.author: Deidre McPhillips, CNN
articles.title: 'We continue to lead the nation.' In West Virginia, Covid-19 vaccinations are nearly double the national rate
articles.description: More than 9% of people in West Virginia have received at least their first dose of a Covid-19 vaccine, according to data published Monday by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. Nationally, that number stands at less than 6%.

articles.author: Esha Mitra and Helen Regan, CNN
articles.title: Republic Day 2021: Indian farmers ramp up their protest by riding tractors into the capital
articles.description: Hundreds of thousands of farmers drove their tractors in convoy into the Indian capital New Delhi on Tuesday, as part of ongoing, nationwide protests against controversial agricultural laws that farmers say put their livelihoods at risk.

articles.author: Eoin McSweeney, CNN
articles.title: Uganda security forces withdraw from Bobi Wine's home
articles.description: Security forces have withdrawn from Ugandan presidential candidate Bobi Wine's residence after he spent 11 days under house arrest, his lawyer told CNN on Tuesday.

articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: New Zealand's borders may stay shut for most of the year, PM Ardern says
articles.description: New Zealand's borders will remain closed for most of this year as the Covid-19 pandemic rages on, but the country will pursue travel arrangements with neighbouring Australia and other Pacific nations, Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern said on Tuesday.

articles.author: Andy Rose and Hollie Silverman, CNN
articles.title: Arizona law enforcement agents are searching for two escaped inmates facing dozens of years in prison
articles.description: Law enforcement agents are on a manhunt for two inmates who escaped an Arizona prison Saturday night.

articles.title: LA Lakers family remembers NBA legend Kobe Bryant one year on
articles.description: January 26, 2020 was a day that many around the world would wish to forget. Kobe Bryant, along with his daughter Gianna and seven others, died in a helicopter crash. A year on, the pain is still felt by those close to the NBA legend in his LA Laker family.

articles.author: Madeline Holcombe and Andy Rose, CNN
articles.title: Portland mayor tells police he pepper-sprayed a man who harassed him over mask policies
articles.description: Portland Mayor Ted Wheeler told police Sunday night that he used pepper spray on a man who had been harassing him about Covid-19 mask policies outside of a restaurant.

articles.author: Christina Maxouris, CNN
articles.title: Everyday activities are more dangerous now that new Covid-19 variants are circulating, expert says
articles.description: Health officials are "extremely" worried about the new Covid-19 variants that have been detected in the US and what they could mean over the coming months, one expert said Monday night.

articles.title: Indian court rules that groping without removing clothes is not sexual assault
articles.description: A court in India has ruled that groping a child through their clothing does not constitute sexual assault, drawing outrage across the country and frustrating campaigners battling to address widespread sexual abuse against women and children.

articles.title: Hotel sustains significant damage after a 'large and extremely dangerous tornado' rips through Birmingham area
articles.description: A tornado described as "large and extremely dangerous" by the National Weather Service (NWS) in Birmingham, Alabama, ripped through a hotel late Monday night.

articles.title: MyPillow CEO Mike Lindell has been banned from Twitter

articles.author: Analysis by James Griffiths, CNN
articles.title: Xi Jinping touts coronavirus cooperation as China persists with vaccine disinformation push
articles.description: Addressing the world's economic elite in Davos on Monday, Chinese President Xi Jinping said that "containing the coronavirus is the most pressing task for the international community."

articles.author: Analysis by Ronald Brownstein
articles.title: On immigration, Biden seeks a new approach to an old deadlock
articles.description: President Joe Biden's early moves on immigration signal his determination to learn from past efforts to reform the system, but that doesn't mean he won't repeat their legacy of frustration.

articles.author: Analysis by Stephen Collinson, CNN
articles.title: Biden aims to tackle another American crisis: Race
articles.description: If there was any doubt about the urgency of President Joe Biden's mission to tackle racial inequality, it was erased in the searing moment an insurrectionist rioter brazenly paraded the Confederate flag through the US Capitol.

articles.author: Laura Ly and Taylor Romine, CNN
articles.title: A judge has approved a $17 million settlement plan for sexual misconduct victims of Harvey Weinstein
articles.description: A US bankruptcy judge has approved a Weinstein Company liquidation plan that allocates over $17 million for Harvey Weinstein's sexual harassment and assault victims, an attorney for the Weinstein Company confirmed to CNN Monday.

articles.title: US-China tech rivalry will likely continue under Biden presidency. Here's why
articles.description: In the Trump era, we witnessed rounds of intensive clashes between US and China in the field of technology. The Biden administration may take a more nuanced approach than Trump to diplomacy, but the tech rivalry will likely continue. CNN's Selina Wang reports.

articles.title: A Disney World ticket booker alerted police to a domestic violence victim after taking their call

articles.author: Jordan Valinsky, CNN Business
articles.title: Pizza Hut debuts a new Detroit-style pizza
articles.description: Pizza Hut is launching a new Detroit-style pizza, which ditches the traditional round shape for a rectangular crust with cheese to the edges that's popular in the Michigan city.

articles.author: Zeena Saifi, CNN
articles.title: Vaccine rollouts lay bare the Middle East's deep inequalities
articles.description: Around the world, the vaccine rollout has shone a harsh light on global income disparities. Rich countries take the lion's share of inoculations, and poorer states scramble to have even the prospect of life after coronavirus.
